parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The premature failure of the catalytic converter can cause the vehicle to fail emissions tests, reduce engine performance, and increase the risk of further engine damage. In addition, the failure can lead to costly repairs and potential environmental harm.
symptoms: The check engine light is illuminated
and the vehicle may experience decreased fuel efficiency.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the electronic power steering system can cause a sudden loss of steering control, making it difficult or impossible to steer the vehicle, which can lead to accidents or loss of control.
symptoms: The vehicle loses all steering control while driving
the steering becomes very difficult to turn
the power steering fails while driving or backing up
unusual noises are heard from the steering system.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the front brake hydraulic hose can cause the brake pedal to travel to the floorboard, resulting in a loss of braking ability, which can lead to accidents or injuries.
symptoms: The brake pedal travels to the floorboard
the brake pedal feels soft or spongy
the vehicle fails to stop when the brake pedal is depressed
